document_data.name: Hammuras
document_data.mainbody: '''Hammuras''' was a [[Waterdhavian]] spice merchant in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Possessions: As of his last meeting, he was carrying a small chest which held [[rubies]].
document_data.History: In early spring of {{yearlink|1373}}, Hammuras was in debt to [[Caethur]]; at a meeting the moneylender had with him and five other debtors in a room overlooking [[Jembril Street]]. He made the payment to Caethur, but after the brass merchant [[Aldurl Nael]] did not, the moneylender murdered the non-paying debtor. Caethur had his men murder all the others anyway, as they were witnesses to the murder.
